result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco S Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Marco S Sanchez was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marco S Sanchez is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Marco S Sanchez was found guilty of Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.

Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AMG. Contact allowed with female juveniles except cannot be alone with them. Child is not included in this group. May not establish, pursue any dating relationships with anyone under age 18. No sleep restrictions on overnights. No restrictions on who can sleep over except no minor females except daughter. May own and use a computer. May go to malls and parks as long as it doesn't conflict with any other condition.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Stayed for compliance of rules. Stay can be lifted upon request of agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco S Sanchez

of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Sentencing hearing on January 10, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Ryan James Hendricks and investigator Kathleen Musinsky.  Matthew D. Moeser with Det. Sgt. Losby appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Issue: custodial interrogation. Det. Sgt R. Losby duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Cross. Questions by court. Redirect. Re-cross. Marco Sanchez duly sworn and testified. Direct by Atty. Hendricks. Cross. Questions by court. Redirect. Re-cross. Court makes findings and finds jury instruction 180 will be read. Jury enters at 9;14 AM. Continued cross testimony of Kathleen M. Redirect. Re-cross. DE duly sworn and testified. Direct by Atty Hendricks. DE plays exhibit 11 CH 15 20150115211250212345, CH 2 20150115203700203759, CH 2 20150115203915204013, CH 2 20150115212319212417. Side bar at 9:44 AM. Ends at 9:46 AM. DE plays exhibit 11 CH 2 20150115212815212940. Cross. Redirect. Re-cross. Jury released for break at 10:07 AM. Court finalizes jury instructions and verdict forms. Jury enters at 11:01 AM. DE rests. Jury instructions read. Closings. Final jury instructions read. Alternate picked and released at 12:16 PM. Bailiff sworn. Jury released for deliberations at 12;19 PM. Jury provides court with questions at 12:55 PM and 1:00 PM. Questions answered and provided to the jury at 1:07 PM. Jury provides court with request at 1:09 PM and question at 1:54 PM. Court brings in parties after jury has lunch to answer question. Question answered at 2:34 PM. Jury brought in at 2:30 PM. Jury released to go back into deliberations at 2:33 PM. Jury reports they have a verdict at 2:45 PM. Jury enters with verdict at 3:14 PM. Verdict read at 3:15 PM. Jury released at 3:17 PM. State moves for judgment on the verdict on ct 4. Ct dismisses cts 1, 2, and 3. DE released on bond as to cts 1, 2, and 3 only. SEH set as to ct 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Ryan James Hendricks and investigator Kathleen Musinsky.  Matthew D. Moeser appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pre-trial and jury instruction matters put on record. Jury enters at 8:59 AM. Oath to final jury given. Jury instructions 50, 103, 000, 148, 55, 58, 300, 145, 110, 140, 101 read. Opening statements. A. M. G. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. DE identified. Exhibit 2 - photo of cooler door. Exhibit 3 - photo of temperature gauges of cooler and freezer. Exhibit 4 - photo of inside of cooler. Exhibit 5 - photo of freezer door. Exhibit 6 - photo of close up view of freezer door. Exhibit 7 - photo of inside of freezer. Exhibit 8 - photo of inside of freezer. Exhibit 9 - photo of inside of freezer. Exhibits 2 - 9 marked, received, and published. Exhibit 1 - video. Portions of video received and published. Exhibit 10 - text messages, marked. Objection. Side bar at 10:09 AM. Ends at 10:11 AM.  Exhibit 10 received under parameters discussed during side bar. Side bar at 10:14 AM. Ends at 10:17 AM. Side bar at 10:19 AM. Ends at 10:21 AM. Jury excused for break at 10:23 AM. Jury enters at 10:45 AM. Cross. Side bar at 10:49 AM. Ends at 10:51 AM. Jury excused at 10:59 AM for parties to discuss matter. Jury enters at 11:08 AM. Jury released for lunch at 11:09 AM. Court back on record at 12:18 PM. Exhibit 11 - DE McDonald's video, marked. Parties stip to portions of video. Jury enters at 12:29 PM.  Exhibit 11 - stipulated portions of DE video received and published. DE plays CH 2 20150115212507212602, CH 11 20150115212916213104, CH 1 20150115213032213437, CH 1 20150115213513213655, CH 14 20150115213548213844, CH 2 20150115212319212417, CH 2 20150115203700203759, CH 2 20150115203915204013, CH 1 20150115202430202828. Redirect. Re-cross. Dawn L. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Exhibit 12 - SANE report, marked and received. Exhibit 13 - Evidence collection kit, marked and received. Exhibit 14 - photo of victim's back with ruler, marked. Exhibit 15 - photo of victim's back, marked. Exhibits 14 and 15 received and published. Redirect. Julie G. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Exhibit 16 - Crime Lab findings, marked. Exhibit 17 - Crime Lab supplemental report, marked. Exhibit 18 - Jordan Shaw buccal swab, marked. Exhibit 19 - DE buccal swab, marked. Exhibit 16 received. Exhibit 18 received. Exhibit 19 received. Jury excused for break at 1:47 PM. Jury enters at 2:06 PM. Exhibit 17 received. Vanessa O. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. DE identified. Side bar at 2:11 PM. Ends at 2:13 PM. Cross. Side bar at 2:15 PM. Ends at 2:20 PM. Det. Sgt.  R. Losby duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. DE identified. Cross. State rests. Jury released for break at 2:34 PM. Court goes back on record to have colloquy with DE regarding testifying. Jury enters at 3:32 PM. Office S. Fogeltanz duly sworn and testified. Direct by Atty Hendricks. Cross. Side bar at 3:38 PM. Ends at 3:41 PM. Kathleen M. duly sworn and testified. Direct by Attorney Hendricks. Cross. Side bar at 3:44 PM. Ends at 3:45 PM. Jury released for the day at 3:46 PM. Court discusses final jury instructions and outstanding custodial issue. Parties to hear at 8 AM on 10/26/16.

Defendant in court with Attorney Ryan James Hendricks.  Matthew D. Moeser appeared for the State of Wisconsin. MIL: DE: State objects to 2, 4, 7, 10, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22. As to DE's additional MIL, State objects to 1, 2, 3. DE original MIL 1 - granted, 2 - denied. 3 - granted. 4 - partially granted. 5 - granted. 6 - granted. 7 - denied. 8 - granted. 9 - granted. 10 - granted. 11 - granted. There is no 12 or 13. 14 - granted. 15 - granted. 16 - granted. 17 - Partially granted as to DV. Partiallly denied as to TRO. 18 - denied. 19 - denied. 20 - granted. 21 - granted. 22 - partially granted. 23 - to be discussed later. DE's additional MIL: 1 - held in abeyance. 2 - Partially granted. 3 - denied. State MIL: 1 - granted. 2 - granted. 3 - granted. 4 - denied. 5 and 6 addressed in DE MIL. 7 - held in abeyance. 8 - 9 -  10 - previously addressed. 11 - granted. 12 - granted. 13 - granted. 14 - previously addressed. Ludwig: State to not recommend prison. Prospective panel enters at 9:55 AM. Oath to prospective panel given. Side bar at 10:02 AM. Ends at 10:03 AM. 23 jurors seated at 10:09 AM. Voir dire. Individual voir dire at 10:44 AM. All jurors re-enter at 12:03 PM. Side bar at 12:10 PM. Ends at 12:11 PM. Parties exercise 5 strikes each. Striken jurors excused at 12:29 PM. Final panel excused at 12:30 PM.

Defendant in court with Attorney Ryan James Hendricks.  Matthew D. Moeser appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Leave on for trial. Ct holds branch policy in regards to STC in abeyance until ruling on DE's MIL. Case to continue to trial.
